arma

Class Span

  • java.lang.Object
    • arma.Span

  • public class Span
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides support for Matlab's index expression range a:b.
    Author:
    Sebastian Niemann

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int _first
      First position of the span
      private boolean _isEntireRange
      Whether the span includes the entire range
      private int _last
      Last position of the span

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Span()
      Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression special range :, but without creating a vector.
      Span(int position)
      Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression range a:a, but without creating a vector.
      Span(int first, int last)
      Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression range a:b, but without creating a vector.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Span all()
      Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression special range :, but without creating a vector.
      (package private) int getFirst()
      Return the last position of the span.
      (package private) int getLast()
      Return the first position of the span.
      (package private) boolean isEntireRange()
      Returns whether the span should include the entire range (true) or a range from the first to the last position (false).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Span

        public Span(int first,
    int last)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression range a:b, but without creating a vector.
        Parameters:
        first - The first element of the span (a)
        last - The last element of the span (b)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The first position needs to be less than equal the last but were first and last.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - All position must be non-negative.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - NaN and infinity are not valid element positions.

      • Span

        public Span(int position)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression range a:a, but without creating a vector.
        Parameters:
        position - The position (a)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - All position must be non-negative.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - NaN and infinity are not valid element positions.

      • Span

        public Span()
        Creates a span similar to Matlab's index expression special range :, but without creating a vector.
